intro: Atelophragma strigulosum, commonly known as the rough-stemmed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured stems and large, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a distinctive pubescent surface, and its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along riverbanks.
